The Berkeley Hotel Pratunam
8.1 Excellent
Based on 28247 reviews

Pros: - Clean and large room. Nice hotel. Very big hotel so need to walk a lot, especially guests staying at the North Tower need to transfer at #11 floor and walk very far.

- Comfortable bed, clean and nice bathroom. The window view is nice too. - Great location. The left side is a big night market right with a lot of nice food and great shopping atmosphere. 7 eleven is beside and many other convenient stores too. The right side is a low-class shopping mall and further down is Pratunam market. Hotel is near to many local cheap massage places and Pratinum Mall, Big C, Central World (just 10 mins walking distance). Overall, location is awesome. - The taxi service counter at the front is friendly and helpful. We booked the Dream World tour and they got everything prepared in a timely and good manner. Cons: - It's a 5-star hotel (as claimed) but there are so many guests at the lobby (must be tours or something) that made the lobby so noisy and crowded and didn't look so high class anymore. Upon checkin, the receptionist was unfriendly (not smiling and very impatient). However, upon checkout, there was another receptionist and she was nice. - Upon checkout, The front staff (those that open the door for you to enter and get out) offered to help book a car for us to transport us to the airport and was very unhappy after we told them that we have already booked one. But after realising that the car we booked was actually from the hotel service, he smiled and acted helpful again. This is the kind of attitude we can't accept. Front staffs represent the hotel so they can't such a poor behaviour.

Show more
Nguyen , Vietnam
SureStay Plus by Best Western Sukhumvit 2
8.4 Excellent
Based on 47 reviews

Stayed 3D2N here at the end on Oct. It is brand new, only just opened in mid-Oct. Its on a quiet alley, Sukhumvit soi 4, which is away from the busy main road.

The location is great under 10min walking distance to Nana BTS. The room was really big & comfortable. Bed was big & soft. The bathroom & stand-in shower is spacious too. The aircon does take abit to cool the room down, so do request for a spare room card so you can leave it cool when you return. They also have a skypool & bar. Pool has a great view especially at night. Pool is opened till 8pm which was great for a evening dip. The breakfast is very simple, with bread, yogurt, fruits (eggs, sausage, bacon need to order) probably you could do without and eat out. They also provide a free buggy shuttle to the main street if you dont want to walk. Overall the staff were very helpful & did their upmost to satisfy my needs. I also had late check out at 2pm which was ideal. I will definitely return just for the room.

Show more
joseph , United Kingdom
Grande Centre Point Hotel Ratchadamri
8.6 Excellent
Based on 9946 reviews

I really dont know from where to start! Pros: Ok i agree that the location is exellant, the door men are very friendly and helpful.

The spa was nice, but that is it! Cons: very old furniture and dusty, the carpet looks dirty and i didnt even wanted to step on it so how if i have a crawling baby!!!!! No blackout curtins!!!!! The water in my room was ethir very hot or very cold, i couldnt get a decent bath. Some of the bed sheets were dirty and and torn. The cleanres leave everything as it is, they only change the bed and dry up the bathroom. The food is very bad, i ordered chicken naggests for my kid but i throw it up immediatly as it didnt look like naggets, round and very hard and wet form inside! When we were checking out the receptionist was very rude, i asked for the bill and she was repeating there is nothing to pay very loudly, all the other hotels gives you checkout papers even if you didnt order anything! Not recommended at all!

Show more
Ahmed , Thailand
Grande Centre Point Hotel Terminal 21
8.6 Excellent
Based on 12150 reviews

I would not recommend this hotel to any one as this is not justify to charged the price base on what I've experienced.

Check in late night after a tiring flight delay, met up with the unfriendly front desk staff. Requested for a connecting room earlier in the email, when we went up the rooms, it's not. Going to the front desk to check, she told us that "you need to pay extra for connecting room" I said I don't mind (I guess this is the only hotel with this rule) and she reply " why not you make the request tomorrow" Toilet was smelly and when my husband trying to lift the seat cover, gosh...all the stains.. Breakfast was awful and service was terrible. Breakfast waiting staff, RUDE. We need to pay for the kids extra charges THB 300 and when I requested for the receipt, the lady (big size) was showing me the rude face. Not sure if she's intending to keep the money by herself.. My tips * if you want to stay in this hotel, bring your own toiletries as they don't even provide a proper set before you check in. We only found out no shower gel when my daughter is half way taking the shower.

Show more
TU , Malaysia
Grande Centre Point Hotel Ploenchit
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5936 reviews

It is quite a new hotel with nice decoration and value for money. Facilities are quite good except the main pool is too high at 1.

5m. I expect certain part to be not so high like 1.2m as in most hotel. Rooms are clean and housekeeping staff at Level 11 quite forgetful to replenish toiletries and never wash used cup and glass. Water boiled from the kettle has a plastic smell and i requested a change. The housekeeping staff took very long to come to change and the look was so unhappy as it is about 10+pm. However, she only bring the kettle and it cannot fit the base of the earlier kettle. I have to call again for a replacement and waited a long time. This time, a more senior staff cane to check and manage to come back with a right one. Thanks to the senior staff i have good water to drink but the attitude of the house maid was not good. Overall, it is a pleasant stay as location is good and room is spacious with good aircon and good shower.

Show more
HWEE , Singapore
Baiyoke Sky Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 22191 reviews

It was my third visit to the hotel and i checked out on 08th Oct 2017 morning at 5.45 am after having stayed for 3 consecutive nights in Room 6508.

i was confirmed by front office yesterday at 5 pm (telephonically who took my flight details, number of persons, number of luggages etc) for a free one way transfer to airport as i stayed for 3 consecutive nights ( as per offers in hotel website). The hotel website doesn't mention whether to book in the website for this free transfer. Hence i took the peconfirmation from the front office a day before. However when i checked out today morning , they completely declined and denied their confirmation. The duty manager who was more careless says they have 60 people in front office and doesn't care a bit who has given the confirmation. He said that you people shouldn't book through trip advisor/agoda to get such freebie whereas the hotel website doesn't mention so. I was completely in disbelief how to manage a taxi in early morning with family after having got such reconfirmation. The bottom line is the front office staff and duty manager have no team coordination and care for the in house guests. One should be doubly careful while dealing with this unreliable team.

Show more
Priyadarshi , India
Arnoma Grand
7.6 Very good
Based on 9720 reviews

Best asset of hotel is its location! Especially if one is in BKK for shopping. It is across Central World ( a big mall) and it is beside Big C Super Center which has the Big C supermarket and several retail and resto outlets.

Big C Supermarket is a hypermart open till midnight. Arnoma is walking distance to both Pratunam where the wholesale market is and Siam area ( BTS Siam station) where one will find Siam Paragon, Siam Center, Siam Discovery, MBK, etc. Closest BTS station is Chit Lom, just a 7-10 min leisurely walk. We reserved a DeLuxe room with breakfast and it turned out to be the biggest room on the floor. Thank you Arnoma for upgrading us! The room has dated look but it is spacious, clean and comfortable. Nice pillows! The bathroom is big, about 2.5x 4 meters big. I liked it that it has a dresser area with seat inside. Shower area is separate from bath tub. Buffet breakfast selection was fine, they change some of the items daily. Staff is courteous and helpful.

Show more
Verona , Philippines
Prince Palace Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 12493 reviews

I've stayed dozens of hotels in bkk and this is for sure the most overrated one. It is evident that the building was built before the time or recharable batteries as the entire room has only two plugins.

There is no wifi in the rooms only common areas where the signal is still a circa 1995 1mb/s down. The hotel location is Teri le with zero restaurants within walking distance.. forcing you to pay overpriced costs of in house restaurants or taking a taxi to and from for each meal. Not even the minibar is stocked as the final evidence that they have just simply given up on trying to accommodate guest past a bare minimum. also there are a lot of insects in the room giving you the feeling the entire building is infested.. all in all not an enjoyable stay.. it was my second time staying here and this is the only reason I leave such a bad review.. both rooms were quite bad in all the forementioned remarks.. I won't be staying a 3rd time.. don't be taken in by the relatively lower price.

Show more
Adam , Canada
Emporium Suites by Chatrium
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3542 reviews

Located in the center of Sukhumvit, the hotel sits atop shopping malls Emporium and Em-Quartier. Both malls have plenty of luxury as well as high-street brands.

Em-Quartier has a very nice food court in the ground floor, with lots of great options for a reasonably priced meal. All the rooms of the hotel are located above the 20th floor and offer amazing views of the city. We were actually looking down on Hilton's rooftop from our 37th floor Studio. The room and bathroom was subtly luxurious and tastefully decorated. The fitness centre is well equipped, well-maintained and clean and there was a yoga class in the morning, while we stayed at the hotel. Pool area is lush little oasis offering respite from the bustle of Bangkok. The breakfast buffet offered something for every taste from croissants to sushi and everything in between. Staff are helpful and attentive and fluent in english.

Show more
Lenike , Denmark
Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok
8.7 Excellent
Based on 9021 reviews

Family suite overlooking the river was fantastic, this is a really busy river used for transportation of cargo as well as people, always fun to watch.

Breakfast variety was amazing, you can really fill up here and well worth going for. Taking your own bottled of water to drink around pool wasn't an option, we found staff could not do enough to help without being intrusive. Well organised boat service running all day until very late evening to connect with main river boats and sky train. There are people to help and maps available to figure it out. Many large smart hotels along the river, options for dining in immediate vicinity a little limited to the hotels and just few restaurants which are pricier the the norm. There is however, plenty of street food in the area but meat orientated (which we don't eat). Abundance of taxis, tuk tuks and can always use the sky train. 7-11 directly next door. We were very impressed, Chatrium was an enjoyable luxury final stop on our 3 weeks travel around Thailand.

Show more
Nicola , United Kingdom
Grande Centre Point Sukhumvit 55 Thong Lo
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1192 reviews

We chose this hotel because we wanted to try a new location in Bangkok, as we always stay in Terminal 21, and this is a fairly new hotel.

Unfortunately, we didn't get to try the Onsen. Pros - access to tuk tuk shuttle was convenient to the BTS station. I believe it's every 20 mins. The rooms and bathroom were clean and new. Our particular room (Triple Room) was quite small for the 3 of us, so I can't speak about the other rooms. Toiletries were ample, but quality was so-so if you're picky about shampoo, etc. Breakfast spread was abundant and expansive. It feels quite indulging to be honest. Great selection and lots of stations. Nice to wake up to this. The setting was white colonial..very soothing and pleasant. Loved the mango sticky rice station and Hot Ginger Tea. The steam room, sauna was nice to use. Locker rooms were available, but lacks any toiletries in the changing room, such as hair brush, deodorant, lotion, slippers, etc. So, bring your own, or do it in your room. Most of all, the staff was extremely friendly, specifically their Social Media coordinator or Manager. I had accidentally left/forgot my silver ring in the lobby bathroom and they found it and kept it for me to pick up. We chatted over Facebook messenger. Extremely prompt response and attentive. Very helpful!! So, thank you for that. Japanese toilets of course, always a plus. Overall, a positive experience.

Show more
YVETTE , United States
Siam Kempinski Hotel Bangkok
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 1515 reviews

This is my third time staying in Kempinski Siam hotel and everytime we feel very happy to stay in this hotel but only this time the service at the breakfast restaurant(near Siam Paragon entrance) wasn't really good.

Actually we can go up to 17th floor the club lounge for breakfast due to i booked for two executive rooms. But i wanted to try the restaurant. The service there not really that good. Two days, we ordered fried eggs abd waited for more than 20 minutes and when asked for the eggs we orfered, the only replied i get from the service lady is "i ordered" and walked away. I understand there were many guests especially from China and maybe thr service staff was busy with many orders but did i just said "service" and hopefully she know what is the meaning of "service". Everything was good except for the above that i mentioned.

Show more
Kheang , Cambodia
Centre Point Pratunam Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7451 reviews

the room was big and clean. the service was very good and all toiletries were replenished. only thing is the toilet.

there is a shower in the bathtub. so you need to climb over the bathtub even if you only want to shower. not so suitable for the elderly and very young children. the water is either very very cold or very very hot. we had to struggle with the shower water everyday which was a dread. other than that, everything was good. there is a row of message parlours and one mani pedi shop along the hotel's main entrance. go before 10pm or else can get really crowded. there is a 7 eleven outside the side entrance of the hotel, which is along the main road. i find some stuff there are about the same price as big c, like lays potato chips and the bento cuttlefish.

Show more
Karen , Singapore
Shangri-La Hotel, Bangkok
9 Excellent
Based on 2618 reviews

Our usual boutique hotel that we normally stay and on the Chao Phraya River was booked. I don't normally like to stay in really large hotels but I thought I would give the Shangri-La a try .

My mother was traveling with us and so we had two rooms. And one of her favorite things is to sit in the morning and watch the traffic on the river and the big balcony at the Shangri-La hotel was perfect for this Another item very important to all of us is a great pool by the river but we can also see what's going on and feel the magic of it. The third thing that's very important to us is a great location. The Shangri-La hotel is located on the Chao Phraya river next to an express boat stop on the river and right under a BTS sky train stop. We got a corner room that had a balcony and a sofa with a window looking out onto the river as well as the window by the bathtub where you could take a bath with a view! We really enjoyed the room.

Show more
James , United States
GLOW Pratunam Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 8984 reviews

Few months ago, the price was considered reasonable but it was almost double increased by the time I booked on last month.

During my 4D3N stay, the hotel staffs were mostly friendly except I never see the male "chef" smile back at the guest, he'd only smile & laugh with his own colleagues. The hotel room was huge but the cleanliness not really up to standard. I didn't sleep well on the first night because the bedsheet feel too itchy to sleep on it so I had to asked the housekeeper to change it on the next day. The desk was oily & dirty upon checked in, I have to use wet tissue to clean it myself. Few things I liked about the room are the huge space, the clean flooring, it is located at the corner & wifi is quite strong. The location of the hotel is good but the entrance is at the side of the building so it is quite inconvenient to walk into the hotel during rainy days & every evening, the restaurant tables will be placed along the way to the hotel entrance. The breakfast is so-so not much variety to choose but I like the dessert though. Well, I'm not against the hotel but I can get a better one with that price paid.

Show more
Jennie , Singapore
Dream Hotel Bangkok
8.4 Excellent
Based on 7786 reviews

I stayed at the Dream hotel for 5 nights (July 13-18). The last time I stayed at this hotel was about 5 years ago! I was pleasantly surprised to see the hotel in such good condition, being nearly the same as it was 5 years ago.

It should be noted that the Dream hotel consists of 2 buildings (Dream 1 and 2). I stayed in Dream 2 in a deluxe room (not large in size but suitable for 1-2 persons), which has the pool and the gym, but not the restaurant, which is in Dream 1. Below are some other positive aspects of this hotel: 1. Great location-- about a 5-10-minute walk to the Asoke BTS station and Terminal 21 mall. 2. There are numerous restaurants, stores and massage shops in walking distance, and thanks to the BTS system, it’s extremely fast and easy to get around to many areas in Bangkok. Further, you can take the BTS to the Phaya Thai station and then take the Airport City Link to Suvarnabhumi airport. The total time with the BTS and Airport Link is about 1 hour. Taxi would be about 40 minutes in normal traffic. 3. Good value for your money (I paid around 14,000 baht for 5 nights that included breakfast). Keep in mind this is low season. 4. Gym, spa and pool. 5. Buffet breakfast was included in my price and was decent (nothing super). 6. The bell hops and guards who helped you cross the street were wonderful. 7. Fairly quick check-in and check-out service but no express or pre-check-out system. 8. Free shuttle service to the Asoke BTS station/Terminal 21 shopping mall. 9. Internet was fast and stable. Negative aspects of the hotel. 1. The reception staff members, to my surprise, are not very friendly, and try to avoid eye contact whenever I passed by, apparently to avoid having to say hello. 2. On the 3rd day the electricity was shut-off from around 09.00-14.30 because Bangkok city was making some repairs/upgrades in the area. I think the hotel should inform their guests of this when they book, so the guest can decide whether to stay or book another hotel, at lea

Show more
leslie , Sweden
Asia Hotel Bangkok
7.6 Very good
Based on 13415 reviews

When I checked into my room, the person who helped me take my bags up had a hard time opening the room door with the key.

The door lock kept showing a red light, indicating that the key wouldn't open the door. He slid it in and out of the slot several times until it finally showed a green light. Instead of changing the key for me, he told me that when I need to enter the room, I should do the same thing. Also, upon my arrival at the room, I found a used bar of soap in the shower. The pencil provided with the notepad in the room had been chewed with bite marks on it. The water would not go down the shower drain. So I asked to change rooms. The people in the front desk could not understand my explanation for wanting another room so it took a while for them to grant my request. Upon entering my new room, it smelled of urine even from outside the bathroom door. For me 3 days in the new room, the smell of urine never went away. My new key to my new room was working initially, then later on it stopped working twice. The first time, the housekeeping staff on our floor opened my door for me, but the second time it happened, when I came back to the room very late at night carrying a heavy sleeping child, the housekeeping staff whom I saw in the hallway of my floor told me to go back down to the lobby and get my key changed myself. Upon checkout at 5AM, the wait was so long because there were two other (separate) guests who trying to checkout and were being charged for bathrobes that their housekeeping staff insisted they had placed in their rooms, but were not there. The manager handled the situation poorly, causing one of the guests to miss their train to the airport. This was a great place to stay as a solo traveler. The owners were very welcoming and helpful, and the room felt like an oasis in the city.

I loved the deck right off the room where I could watch the river traffic go by. It's also very close to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho and Wat Arun, just a few minutes by river boat which is a delightful way to travel. My favorite thing about Ibrik was the neighborhood, which is quiet and non-touristy. The temple at the end of the street is gorgeous, and frequented by neighbors and monks and friendly kids, not tourists. I enjoyed joining in the morning and evening services there. There is also a local market one block away with food and cheap, gorgeous clothes. Two restaurants right next door, both with outdoor decks to eat by the river. The closest is beautiful and upscale and relaxing, with mediocre food (I thought, after one meal); the second is dressed-down, family-owned, and the owners are friendly and take good care of you if you have a cold! I also enjoyed the breakfast on the deck. You decide the night before what you want (Western breakfast items) and what time. Halfway through breakfast they brought a bonus course of fresh mango. Really nice way to start the day. Also: the bed was supportive and comfortable, and the air conditioning welcome in the 98-degree heat. And there's a mini bar (non-alcoholic) in the room for convenient snacking. One thing to note: at night there are a lot of party cruise boats that go by, so if you go to bed early you'll hear music intermittently. I found this charming, but if you want a quieter room there's one that doesn't face the river (you can still hang out on the deck).

Bang Phlat is not an obvious choice to stay in Bangkok but now that we've done it I can highly recommend it as its a real Thai neighbourhood somewhat off the beaten track.

Bang Phlat itself is a 10-15 minute bus ride (6 baht, an experience in itself) from Khao San And Rambutree or you can catch a water bus by the Ratchawithi bridge and travel all the way down to Thon Buri and the temples at Wat Arun. Stick food (deep fried food on sticks) rules along the busy Charon Sanitwong road which runs through Bang and street vendors also sell the local delicious iced tea cha yen, made with ice, strong red tea leaves and evaporated and condensed milk. The Bang Phlat Resort however is a hidden gem of comfort, tranquility and luxury in this bustling neighbourhood of Bangkok. Bang Phlat resorts quaint traditional wooden houses boast two double bed rooms each (ground floor and first floor) with bathroom, air conditioning, free wi-fi and beautiful wooden furniture. Breakfast options consist of Thai rice soup with either chicken or shrimp, both of which are delicious or alternatively American breakfast is available. Tesco Lotus is virtually opposite the entrance to the hotel and there's a small shopping mall with some restaurants should you want something more substantial to break your fast.

The next day our search began early. I discovered that Dinsomon Hotel is on Dinso Road, but on the other side of Democracy Monument. A combination of clueless locals and my inability to use my brain properly delayed our check-in. Now to the good stuff. Upon arriving, the staff was EXTREMELY friendly. There were no issues getting us into our room. This boutique hotel was very clean, very intimate, and felt like a little oasis from the chaos of Khao San. My favorite part of the stay was the pool. It's a small pool but, again, very intimate and tucked away from the chaos. It was a great feeling after having lugged our stuff all over Khao San. The breakfast was also very good. If you would like to experience Khao San, but not live in it...this is THE place. I can't recommend it highly enough for the professional and kind staff, and cleanliness. I only wish I had found them a day sooner!

We stayed for two nights in the Arun Suite at the Arun Residence in the Old City of Bangkok. It's true that the view of the Wat Arun across the river, especially at night, is stunning.

However, one cannot live on the view alone. There were two major issues. First, we could not get a cab driver to take us directly to this hotel. We asked countless cabs only to have them firmly shake their head no and drive off. They simply won't go. So we asked to take us to the Wat Pho, which is nearby the hotel, and while they would at least agree to take us there, none would take us using the meter and all wanted an inflated flat rate. So when you have luggage or it's raining or it's late at night, this really, really sucks. And it didn't matter having the card the hotel gives you that has the hotel name and address written in Thai. None of the cabs would take us to this hotel. There is no BTS Skytrain or MRT subway stop close by either. You have to take a ferry down the river to the Central Pier to get to a Skytrain stop (Taksin). This takes a lot of time and costs as much as a taxi, if you can get one. Second, the Arun suite has significant maintenance issues. The toilet button didn't work, so we had to take the toilet tank lid off and depress the flush trigger every time we went to the bathroom. The shower door wouldn't close all the way, so every time we showered, a lot of water leaked out and left the bathroom mat completely soaked. The TV would not work with "No Signal" on every station. And one of the pillowcases had a stain that looked like someone had a nosebleed. Housekeeping never changed it - so gross. When you call the front desk, they don't answer. So we went down to the lobby to let them know about these issues. Nothing but the TV issue was fixed during our stay. Ridiculous! While the hotel is a unique experience, it's not the kind of experience I want in the future or can recommend to anyone who wants a toilet that functions properly for the premium you're paying.

Check in was quick and efficient and day staff friendly and welcoming. The added touch of some icy water and a refreshing hand towel was very nice. The staff were on the whole very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and overlooked the river. A little smaller than I expected but to be honest for our needs was more than sufficient - and there was enough room to open up and lay out cases. It was a little uncomfortable having to come back to stuffy rooms as once you leave the room and take your key card from the slot the power goes off. This was common all across Thailand so not specific to this hotel at all. Enjoyed some of the free biscuit snacks and sweets that were in the jars in the lobby. Had some fruit juice one evening before going off for a massage and they were lovely. Of course a little pricier than out on the streets but still cheap for western travelers. There was a computer down in the lobby with books for guest use. Found the wifi to be fair and had not real problems with it. Nice stay, would recommend.

Michelle , United Kingdom
The Myth-Sud Sathorn
9 Excellent
Based on 85 reviews

We took a risk to stay in this very new B&B with hardly any reviews, but were very pleasantly surprised.

Location wise, it is just within a couple of hundred metres at most from Saphan Taksin BTS and the boat piers - very convenient for going almost anywhere in BKK by almost any mode of transport! The house has a lot of history over a hundred years, and it has been newly restored and converted to a B&B. It is family run and the service is great and very personal, they even take you on a 'tour' to explain the history of the house. Breakfast is served in a nicely restored dining room or by the open yard and is freshly prepared like homemade food only when you arrive. The meals though simple are nice - more like eating in someone's home than the run-off-the-mill stuff you get at many hotels. The rooms have high ceilings and all the furniture is custom made and new. They have a few minor hiccups as with any new place, but I'm sure they will sort this out in no time. Only major negative is the location is beside a highway so it can be a bit noisy - this was not a problem for us but light sleepers may find this a challenge. At this price it is great value and we enjoyed out stay. IMHO it's a real gem of an accommodation in BKK.

everytime i go to bangkok, i will choose a special place to stay at. rather than 5-star hotels, i usually stay at small boutique inns or hotels and try to have a special experience.

Firstly you should only consider this if you love nature. I liked the quirky 4 baht ferry ride across the pier to bangkok tree house, it's off beat location on the less known side of BKK, the lovely sumptuous breakfast, very nicely decorated and comfortable rooms (and desktop computer loaded with 'green movies' which my boyfriend and I loved to watch), spacious 'outdoor' shower and rooftop skybed.

You can also get lovely snacks near the pier, and watch the local aunties engage in aerobics of sorts during weekday evenings at the primary school near the jetty which is really interesting! However, for someone who is less skilled at cycling, i find that the activities on the island are more limited. The island is really too huge to be covered by foot. My boyfriend who is an avid cyclist, loved the place as you can easily cycle to a lot of attractions. Staff was polite and curt, not really very warm or friendly but was helpful. The cycling tour guide Paul was very chatty and a great guide to my boyfriend. Overall I really liked the stay but for the price we paid, it was really too much... felt like a more luxurious Pulau Ubin (a singapore offshore island) island stay. would not recommend dining there for dinner because you will be SWARMED with sandflies. the mosquito coils that the staff burned didn't help much- both my boyfriend and I had multiple bites... food was quite tasty though, so it was a pity the experience was lacklustre. Breakfast on the other hand was fairly pleasant, with little/no disturbance from insects. On other thing- it can get a bit noisy with all the speedboats/boats roaring late into the night, and starting really early in the morning. if you decide to stay be sure to stay on a weekend and visit the floating market and also go for a bike tour with Paul. No need to pay extra for the room with a view or the family nest. You can easily take photos of these two without staying there, and they're definitely not worth the price

More about Bangkok

Bangkok is the capital of Thailand, and serves as a gateway for this region. Bangkok is served by Suvarnabhumi International Airport , which is one of the busiest and most important travel hubs in Asia, as well as the regional Don Muang Airport, which serves many of the regional airlines. Hotels in Bang Na are popular with travelers making quick stopovers as the area is within close proximity of the international airport.

Bangkok is a diverse and sprawling city without a dedicated central district. Instead, the major activity follows the major roads of Sukhumvit and Silom through the length of the metropolis. Visitors to this city will have endless options for accommodations, shopping, and some of the most exciting nightlife in Southeast Asia. 

Getting around Bangkok used to be tricky, but modern infrastructure changes and the use of sky trains continues to make transportation easier.

The cosmopolitan energy in Bangkok is exhilarating, but it's easy to see that this city also plays an integral role in Thai culture and history. No sooner do tourists round the corner of a brand-new skyscraper than they come face-to-face with a centuries-old temple or an eclectic open-air market. The city features many unforgettable sites such as the Temple of Dawn, the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew, which is known as the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. Bangkok remains endlessly fascinating and surprising even to its residents. There’s much more to see and learn about Bangkok, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks, hotels, and attractions of this vibrant city.

1 More about Bangkok Bangkok is the capital of Thailand, and serves as a gateway for this region. Bangkok is served by Suvarnabhumi International Airport , which is one of the busiest and most important travel hubs in Asia, as well as the regional Don Muang Airport, which serves many of the regional airlines. Hotels in Bang Na are popular with travelers making quick stopovers as the area is within close proximity of the international airport. Bangkok is a diverse and sprawling city without a dedicated central district. Instead, the major activity follows the major roads of Sukhumvit and Silom through the length of the metropolis. Visitors to this city will have endless options for accommodations, shopping, and some of the most exciting nightlife in Southeast Asia. Getting around Bangkok used to be tricky, but modern infrastructure changes and the use of sky trains continues to make transportation easier. The cosmopolitan energy in Bangkok is exhilarating, but it's easy to see that this city also plays an integral role in Thai culture and history. No sooner do tourists round the corner of a brand-new skyscraper than they come face-to-face with a centuries-old temple or an eclectic open-air market. The city features many unforgettable sites such as the Temple of Dawn, the Grand Palace and Wat Phra Kaew , which is known as the Temple of the Emerald Buddha. Bangkok remains endlessly fascinating and surprising even to its residents. There’s much more to see and learn about Bangkok, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks, hotels, and attractions of this vibrant city.
